primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer must develop a 'plan' and exert personal effort to reach the goal of Christian maturity and social justice, modeled after Paul's perseverance.

tekstueel_bewijs: I am willing to climb whatever hill

object.identificatie: The Prize / The Goal (Maturity, Social Change, Democracy)
tekstueel_bewijs: the prize of the high calling
the level of freedom and democracy
to be what the Lord wants us to be

zender.identificatie: The Moral Law / The Example of Paul
tekstueel_bewijs: Paul says that... it ought to humble all of us
We ought to confess that we have not yet reached what we should
we would be a better people
the Lord could do great things with us
if my prayer life had been deeper
God's mercy stoops low... to help us
helper.rol_van_god: Helper (God is the one who 'helps' the human subject press on)

tegenstander.identificatie: Past failures, Slavery (as a mindset), Drugs, Weakness
tekstueel_bewijs: forgetting those things which are behind
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily the 'weight' of the past or social ills that the subject must overcome through 'pressing'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's eschatological transformation of the believer into the likeness of Christ.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (God's work) is used as a motivation for the primary program (Human pressing).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Paul's Example → The Prize → The Christian

voorbeelden_god_subject: God shall wipe away all tears
the Lord could do great things with us
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We need to put that behind us
I have not yet won my right to be called a child of God

voorbeelden: I want to talk with you
we have not yet been able to find out
we are unable to influence our communities
able to turn back the powers of darkness

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily weighted toward obligation (Devoir). It assumes the hearer has the inherent capacity but lacks the 'plan' or 'will'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (the past/slavery) through ~S2 (forgetting) toward S1 (the mark).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in human persistence ('Press on!') supported by divine pity.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a psychological/historical weight rather than a radical ontological death.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses the language of 'grace' and 'salvation,' the actantial subject is consistently the human 'I' who must plan, press, and win the right to be a child of God.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I have not yet won my right to be called a child of God.
the Lord could do great things with us [if we are willing].

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: when he shall appear we shall be like him

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul is presented as the ultimate athlete/hero whose sacrifices shame the hearer into action.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on Christ as the one who 'pressed' into death for Paul, which then 'apprehended' Paul.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Burden of performance; guilt for not 'pressing' hard enough.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is synergistic; God waits for human initiative.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is rhetorically powerful but theologically confused, mixing 'winning the right' with 'grace'.
spanning_punten: The claim of 'winning the right to be a child of God' vs 'alphabet of grace'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: I press toward the mark for the prize... I have not yet won my right.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit 'teaches' but the soul must 'catch' it.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'failing to reach the goal' or 'weakness' rather than total depravity.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'call to the will' where the human is the Subject and God is a Helper/Sender. It lacks a Primary Program where God is the Subject of salvation.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the one 'pressing' to win a right.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Christ is the one who 'apprehended' Paul (and the hearer).
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'I have not yet won my right,' use 'Christ has won the right for me, and now He carries me toward the mark.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the verb 'apprehended' in the passive voice in the text.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Shift from 'we ought to be strong' to 'Christ is our strength in our weakness'.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Sin as a power that makes 'pressing' impossible without a Subject-switch.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To make Grace necessary rather than just helpful.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (the plan) precedes or defines Soteriology (becoming a child of God).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. God apprehends us (Grace). 2. We press because we are held (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has immense social and rhetorical power, but it risks crushing the hearer under the law of 'pressing' without the assurance of being already held by Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, this is a masterpiece of motivation; semiotically, it is a legalistic engine.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would note Paul's emphasis on 'being apprehended by Christ'; this sermon reverses that into 'winning the right'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the word 'grace', the functional Subject is the human ego.

volledige_object_lijst: right to be called a child of God
appendices.notities: The phrase 'I have not yet won my right to be called a child of God' is the most semiotically significant departure from a grace-oriented structure.
